text: this is Martin Fackler reporting from
naka minato a small fishing village in
northern central Japan right now the
Japanese military the self-defense force
has come in to try to find survivors but
mainly they're still trying to get a
sense of the death toll and of the
extent of the destruction a lot of the
devastation is seen only by helicopter
at this point and we get these horrific
images of what were once cities or towns
and now they're just basically mud flats
the death toll looks certain to rise far
above the current number of about 1300
we've got reports now that officials
cannot reach a city of about 20,000
people in Miyagi Prefecture which is
near the epicenter of the earthquake and
about half of the residents of the city
are unaccounted for there was an
explosion today at a nuclear reactor in
northern Japan that injured four people
and that worried people for a while that
there may be some sort of a meltdown or
larger problem though it appears now
that the explosion was outside reactor
and did not affect the core of the
reactor with the nuclear material is
well I visited today the town had been
hit hard by the tsunami residents also
reported that when the earthquake struck
shaking was so hard that they couldn't
stand and some of them actually had to
crawl across the shaking earth in order
to get to safety because within minutes
after the shaking a tsunami came
barreling into the town and so it was
really a one-two punch
